intro: Hieracium zygophorum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky areas, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Hieracium zygophorum is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
